meanings.definition: A sweet, chewy candy flavored with an extract of the licorice root.
meanings.sent1: I bought some licorice at the store for a tasty treat.
meanings.sent2: The licorice was the best-selling candy at the fair.
meanings.sent3: The licorice candy danced in the jar, tempting me to grab a piece.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as sweet as licorice, filling the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The licorice melted in my mouth, leaving a delightful flavor behind.

meanings.definition: A plant of the pea family with long, slender, sweet-tasting roots.
meanings.sent1: The licorice plant in the garden had vibrant green leaves.
meanings.sent2: Farmers harvested licorice roots to make natural sweeteners.
meanings.sent3: The licorice plant whispered secrets to the neighboring flowers.
meanings.sent4: Her hair cascaded down her back like licorice vines, flowing and dark.
meanings.sent5: The licorice roots dug deep into the earth, seeking nutrients for growth.
